___batch.description: The batch from which the cell line is derived. Primarily applicable to initial H1 cell line batches. NA if not applicable.

___medium.description: The medium in which the cell line has been grown.

___line.description: The name of the cell line.

___differentiation_method.description: The protocol used to differentiation the cell line.

___lineage.description: The developmental lineage to which the cell line belongs.

___passage.description: The number of times the cell line has been re-plated and allowed to grow back to confluency or to some maximum density if using suspension cultures.

___differentiation_stage.description: The stage in cell differentiation to which the cell line belongs.

___markers.description: Markers used to isolate and identify the cell type.

items.description: (Ontology: UBERON) links to the tissue from which sample was extracted.

___passage_if_expanded.description: If the primary cell has been expanded, the number of times the primary cell has been re-plated and allowed to grow back to confluency or to some maximum density if using suspension cultures. NA if no expansion.

___origin_sample.description: Description of the origin tissue from which sample was extracted.

___markers.description: Markers used to isolate and identify the cell type.

___culture_conditions.description: The conditions under which the primary cell was cultured.

items.description: (Ontology: UBERON) links to the tissue from which sample was extracted.

___passage_if_expanded.description: If the primary cell culture has been expanded, the number of times the primary cell culture has been re-plated and allowed to grow back to confluency or to some maximum density if using suspension cultures. NA if no expansion.

___origin_sample.description: Description of the origin tissue from which sample was extracted.

___tissue_depot.description: Details about the anatomical location from which the primary tissue was collected.

___collection_method.description: The protocol for collecting the primary tissue.

description: The IHEC Data Hub Sample schema covers all metadata requested by IHEC Metadata Standards, as specified here: https://github.com/IHEC/ihec-metadata/blob/master/specs/Ihec_metadata_specification.md
title: IHEC Data Hub Sample schema

_88donor.description: Additional set of properties for samples coming from a donor.

___donor_ethnicity.description: The ethnicity of the donor that provided the primary cell. NA if not available. If dealing with small/vulnerable populations consider identifiability issues.

___donor_health_status.description: The health status of the donor that provided the primary cell. NA if not available.

___donor_age.description: The age of the donor that provided the cells/tissues. NA if not available. If over 90 years enter as 90+. If entering a range of ages use the format “{age}-{age}”.

___donor_id.description: An identifying designation for the donor that provided the cells/tissues.

items.description: (Ontology: NCIM) Links to the health status of the donor that provided the primary cell. The NCImetathesaurus term C0277545 'Disease type AND/OR category unknown' should be used for unknown diseases. For samples without any known disease, use the NCImetathesaurus term C0549184 'None'. Phenotypes associated with the disease should be submitted as DISEASE_ONTOLOGY_CURIEs (if available) or in the free form DISEASE attribute. If dealing with a rare disease, please consider identifiability issues.

___biological_replicates.description: List of biological replicate sample accessions

___disease.description: Free form field for more specific sample disease information. This property reflects the disease for this particular sample, not for the donor health condition. If dealing with a rare disease consider identifiability issues.

___biomaterial_provider.description: The name of the company, laboratory or person that provided the biological material.

items.description: (Ontology: NCIM) links to sample disease ontology information. This property reflects the disease for this particular sample, not for the donor health condition. The NCImetathesaurus term C0277545 “Disease type AND/OR category unknown” should be used for unknown diseases. Phenotypes associated with the disease should be submitted as DISEASE_ONTOLOGY_CURIEs (if available) or in the free form DISEASE attribute. For samples without any known disease, use the NCImetathesaurus C0549184 term 'None'. If dealing with a rare disease consider identifiability issues.

___treatment.description: Any artificial modification (differentiation, activation, genome editing, etc).

items.description: (Ontology: EFO) links to sample ontology information.
